intro: Ligusticum cuminum, commonly known as Chinese lovage, is a perennial herb native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its roots and leaves are used in traditional Chinese medicine for their purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties. Ligusticum cuminum is also valued in culinary applications for its distinctive, slightly spicy aroma.
